title: Ticket #3696: RPM package on SL6 needs python 2.4 but 2.6 is installed
description:
Report in htcondor-users of attempt to update installation of HtCondor on an SL6 32 bit (updated to 6.4) machine failure. It seems like Condor needs Python 2.4 but 2.6 is installed.

See details incl RPM logs here.
remarks:
2013-Jun-12 10:48:30 by tannenba:
Please excuse my packaging ignorance, but do we really need to have a dependency at all on any version of Python? Is it just for the Python API bindings? If so, seems like HTCondor would run just fine without Python, and any folks who want to use the Python API bindings likely already have Python :).

2013-Jun-12 11:08:26 by bbockelm:
Hi Todd,

Yes, you need the dependency on python.

It's possible that the user is installing the SL5 package on SL6. When I look at the 32-bit SL6 RPM, I see a dependency on python2.6

[bbockelm@hcc-briantest condor-build]$ rpm -qp --requires http://research.cs.wisc.edu/htcondor/yum/stable/rhel6/condor-8.0.0-133173.rhel6.4.i686.rpm | grep python /usr/bin/python libpython2.6.so.1.0 python(abi) = 2.6

Brian

2013-Jun-13 13:31:48 by tim:
The user selected the wrong repository (RHEL6). Changing to the correct repository (RHEL5) solved his problem.
creator: tannenba
